title: rna_singlesample
description: Processing unimodal single-sample RNA transcriptomics data.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

id.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample
id.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `foo`. ID of the sample.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `dataset.h5mu`. Path to the sample
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `dataset.h5mu`. Path to the sample.

layer.description: Type: `string`. Input layer to start from
layer.help_text: Type: `string`. Input layer to start from. By default, .X will be used.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Destination path to the output
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Destination path to the output.

min_counts.description: Type: `integer`, example: `200`. Minimum number of counts captured per cell
min_counts.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `200`. Minimum number of counts captured per cell.

max_counts.description: Type: `integer`, example: `5000000`. Maximum number of counts captured per cell
max_counts.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `5000000`. Maximum number of counts captured per cell.

min_genes_per_cell.description: Type: `integer`, example: `200`. Minimum of non-zero values per cell
min_genes_per_cell.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `200`. Minimum of non-zero values per cell.

max_genes_per_cell.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1500000`. Maximum of non-zero values per cell
max_genes_per_cell.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1500000`. Maximum of non-zero values per cell.

min_cells_per_gene.description: Type: `integer`, example: `3`. Minimum of non-zero values per gene
min_cells_per_gene.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `3`. Minimum of non-zero values per gene.

min_fraction_mito.description: Type: `double`, example: `0.0`. Minimum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial
min_fraction_mito.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `0.0`. Minimum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial. Requires --obs_name_mitochondrial_fraction.

max_fraction_mito.description: Type: `double`, example: `0.2`. Maximum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial
max_fraction_mito.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `0.2`. Maximum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial. Requires --obs_name_mitochondrial_fraction.

var_name_mitochondrial_genes.help_text: Type: `string`. In which .var slot to store a boolean array corresponding the mitochondrial genes.

obs_name_mitochondrial_fraction.description:
Type: `string`. When specified, write the fraction of counts originating from mitochondrial genes 
(based on --mitochondrial_gene_regex) to an
obs_name_mitochondrial_fraction.help_text:
Type: `string`. When specified, write the fraction of counts originating from mitochondrial genes 
(based on --mitochondrial_gene_regex) to an .obs column with the specified name.
Requires --var_name_mitochondrial_genes.

var_gene_names.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `gene_symbol`. .var column name to be used to detect mitochondrial genes instead of .var_names (default if not set).
Gene names matching with the regex value from --mitochondrial_gene_regex will be identified
as a mitochondrial gene.

mitochondrial_gene_regex.description: Type: `string`, default: `^[mM][tT]-`. Regex string that identifies mitochondrial genes from --var_gene_names
mitochondrial_gene_regex.help_text:
Type: `string`, default: `^[mM][tT]-`. Regex string that identifies mitochondrial genes from --var_gene_names.
By default will detect human and mouse mitochondrial genes from a gene symbol.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
